intro: Tragacantha pissisi, commonly known as the Astragalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia, where it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by distinctive, spiny seed pods. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Tragacantha pissisi is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it an important plant in ecological restoration efforts.
